result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron T Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Added to current payment plan.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Defendant may apply for expungement at age 23 if he has no further criminal acts.

cancel per SO inmate sheet; custody JASO 9/15/16
DNA Proof of Submission form returned from JASO

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.   Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1.  Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the elements for disorderly conduct.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Court found the defendant guilty of count 1.  Joint recommendation for $100., plus costs.  Attorney Poss asks for 50. fine.  May petition for expungment at age 23 if he has no further criminal acts.   Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  $100., plus costs. and DNA surcharge.  $379.00 + 200.00 = $579.00 total.  Add to current payment plan.  May petition for expungment at age 23 if he has no further criminal acts.
